text.0: rich in all blessings aśvins come ye hither this place on earth is called your own possession.
text.1: like a strong horse with a fair back it standeth whereon as in a lap ye seat you firmly.
text.2: this most delightful eulogy awaits you in the mans house drinkoffering hath been heated.
text.3: which bringeth you over the seas and rivers yoking astwere two wellmatched shining horses.
text.4: whatever dwellings ye possess o aśvins in fields of men or in the streams of heaven.
text.5: resting upon the summit of the mountain or bringing food to him who gives oblation.
text.6: delight yourselves ye gods in plants and waters when Ṛṣis give them and ye find they suit you.
text.7: enriching us with treasures in abundance ye have looked back to former generations.
text.8: aśvins though ye have heard them oft aforetime regard the many prayers which Ṛṣis offer.
text.9: come to the man even as his heart desireth may we enjoy your most delightful favour.
text.10: come to the sacrifice offered you nāsatyas with men oblations and prayer duly uttered.
text.11: come to vasiṣṭha as his heart desireth for unto you these holy hymns are chanted.
text.12: this is the thought this is the song o aśvins accept this hymn of ours ye steers with favour.
text.13: may these our prayers addressed to you come nigh you preserve us evermore ye gods with blessings.
